moves.3. Bc4: Steinitz Variation of the Philidor Defense.  The classic response is d4 instead, but I like this move.
moves.3... h6 4. Nc3 Be7 5. d3 Nf6 6. Be3 c6 7: Black doubles two columns of white pawns with this trade.
moves.16. O-O-O Re5 17. f4 Rxh5 18. exd5 cxd5: Oops.  White kind of forks the cornered rook with this move.  Black would have been better off taking that pawn with the rook.
moves.19. Bxd5+ Kh8 20. Bxb7 Qxd4 21. Rxd4 Na6: By threatening the center rook, Nc6 sacrifices the black knight to preserve the rook.
